org.ejvm.inspection

Class EjvmProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejvm.inspection.EjvmProgram

  • public final class EjvmProgram
extends Object

    Represents a compiled eJVM program and offers methods to retrieve information about said program from its compiled form, e.g. the number of methods or constants.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe
    See Also:
    EjvmProcess

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ADDRESS_SIZE
      Number of bytes used for offsets in the executable.
      static int CCNT_ADDRESS
      Address of the ccnt field in the executable, containing the number of entries in the program's constant table.
      static int CTBL_BASE
      Static part of the address of the ctbl field in the executable, containing all constants defined in this program.
      static int ERRCNT_ADDRESS
      Address of the errcnt field in the executable, containing the number of entries in the program's error message table.
      static byte[] MAGIC_NUMBER
      Magic number (ASCII-encoded 'eJVM') found at the beginning of every compiled eJVM program file.
      static int MCNT_ADDRESS
      Address of the mcnt field in the executable, containing the number of methods in the method table.
      static int MTBL_ADDRESS
      Address of the method table in the executable, containing an entry for every compiled method of the program.
      static int MTBL_ENTRY_SIZE
      Number of bytes an entry of the method table requires.
      static int PNADDR_ADDRESS
      Address of the pnoff field in the executable, containing the byte offset to the first byte of the program's name.
      static int PNSIZE_ADDRESS
      Address of the pnsize field in the executable, containing the length of the program's name (in bytes).
      static int TEXT_BASE
      Static part of the address of the text section of the executable, containing the compiled method code.
      static int VNO_ADDRESS
      Address of the vno field in the executable, containing the required minimum version of the eJVM language needed to execute this program.

        public static final byte[] MAGIC_NUMBER

        Magic number (ASCII-encoded 'eJVM') found at the beginning of every compiled eJVM program file.

        public static final int MTBL_ADDRESS

        Address of the method table in the executable, containing an entry for every compiled method of the program.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CTBL_BASE

        public static final int CTBL_BASE

        Static part of the address of the ctbl field in the executable, containing all constants defined in this program. Adding the byte size of the method table yields the real offset to the constant table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TEXT_BASE

        public static final int TEXT_BASE

        Static part of the address of the text section of the executable, containing the compiled method code. Adding the byte size of the method table and the constant table yields the real offset to the text section.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • EjvmProgram

        public EjvmProgram(ByteBuffer bytes)

        Creates a new eJVMProgram with bytes containing the executable's bytes. Checks for formal validity are performed.

        Important: The limit of bytes may be used for length checks, so it is important that it is set in a way that bytes does not to contain any bytes that do not belong to the executable.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte content of the executable file.

      • EjvmProgram

        public EjvmProgram(ByteBuffer bytes,
           boolean performChecks)

        Creates a new eJVMProgram with bytes containing the executable's bytes. Checks if the executable is formally valid are optional.

        Important: The limit of bytes may be used for length checks, so it is important that it is set in a way that bytes does not to contain any bytes that do not belong to the executable.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte content of the executable file.
        performChecks - Perform checks after instantiation to make sure this is a (formally) valid eJVM program.

    • Method Detail

      • getProgramNameLength

        public int getProgramNameLength()

        Returns the length of the executed program's name (in bytes) as described by the executable itself.

        Returns:
        The length of the program name in bytes.

      • getProgramNameOffset

        public int getProgramNameOffset()

        Returns the byte offset from the first byte of the executable to the first byte of it's program's name.

        Returns:
        The name offset in bytes.

      • getProgramName

        public String getProgramName()

        Extracts and returns the program name from the executable.

        Returns:
        The name of the program.

      • getRequiredEjvmVersion

        public byte getRequiredEjvmVersion()

        Returns the minimal version number of the eJVM language needed to execute this program. The upper four bit represent the major, the lower four bit the minor component of the version number.

        This version number can be converted into an easier to read format using the following code: 

         byte versionByte = program.getRequiredeJVMVersion();
 String versionNumber = (versionByte >> 4) + "." + versionByte & 0x0F;
        Returns:
        The required eJVM version for execution of this executable's program.

      • getNumberOfConstants

        public byte getNumberOfConstants()

        Returns the number of constants contained in the executable's constant table.

        Returns:
        The number of constants (up to 255).

      • getConstant

        public short getConstant(int index)

        Returns the value of the constant at index. Please note that it is the index inside the constant table, not the offset from the beginning of the executable or the constant table.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the constant in the constant table.
        Returns:
        The value of the constant at index.

      • getNumberOfMethods

        public int getNumberOfMethods()

        Returns the number of entries in the method table.

        Returns:
        The number of methods.

      • getMethodOffset

        public int getMethodOffset(int index)

        Returns the offset from the beginning of the executable's bytes to the first byte of the compiled code of the method at index in the method table.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the method in the method table.
        Returns:
        The offset to the first byte of the compiled method code.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is smaller 0 or bigger than the actual method table.

      • getMainMethodOffset

        public int getMainMethodOffset()

        Returns the offste to the main method's first instruction.

        Returns:
        The offset of the main method.

      • getTextSectionOffset

        public int getTextSectionOffset()

        Returns the byte offset to the beginning of the program's text section.

        Returns:
        The offset to the text section.

      • getTextSectionSize

        public int getTextSectionSize()

        Returns the size of the program's text section (i.e. the compiled instructions).

        Returns:
        The size of the text section.

      • getNumberOfErrorMessages

        public int getNumberOfErrorMessages()

        Returns the number of error messages in the executable.

        Returns:
        The number of error messages.

      • getErrorMessageTableOffset

        public int getErrorMessageTableOffset()

        Returns the offset to the first byte of the first entry in the error message table. If the table contains no error messages, -1 is returned.

        Returns:
        The offset to the start of the error message table or -1 if no error messages were found in the executable.

      • getErrorMessage

        public String getErrorMessage(int index)

        Retrieves the error message from index in the error message table and returns it.

        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        The error message from index index or an empty string if the executable does not contain any error messages.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • getMethodInformation

        public List<MethodInformation> getMethodInformation()

        Returns an unmodifiable List of MethodInformation objects containing all available information for a method included in the executable. If the executable was compiled without debug information, the corresponding fields in the MethodInformation object will be filled with default values.

        Returns:
        An unmodifiable List of MethodInformation objects.
        See Also:
        getMethodInformation(int)

      • getMethodInformation

        public MethodInformation getMethodInformation(int index)

        Returns a MethodInformation object containing all available information for the method found at method table index index included in the executable. If the executable was compiled without debug information, the corresponding fields in the MethodInformation object will be filled with default values.

        Parameters:
        index - The index of the method in the method table.
        Returns:
        A MethodInformation object for the method at index.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is negative or bigger than the highest method index in the method table.
        See Also:
        getMethodInformation()

      • getProgramLength

        public int getProgramLength()

        Returns the length of the complete program in bytes.

        Returns:
        The byte length of the program.

      • getByteView

        public ByteBuffer getByteView()

        Returns a read-only ByteBuffer to access the program bytes.

        Returns:
        A read-only ByteBuffer for the program bytes.

      • fromFile

        public static EjvmProgram fromFile(Path executable)

        Creates a new EjvmProgram with the content from executable.

        Parameters:
        executable - The file to read the program from.
        Returns:
        An EjvmProgram instance representing the eJVM program read from executable.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If executable does not exist.
        RuntimeException - In case of any IO error.

      • fromFile

        public static EjvmProgram fromFile(Path executable,
                   ByteBuffer buffer,
                   int offset)

        Creates a new EjvmProgram with the content from executable. Instead of creating a new ByteBuffer for the program, buffer is used to store the program bytes, starting at offset .

        Important: This method is not free of side effects. Not only the content of buffer is changed, but limit and position may also be changed during execution of the method. However, they limit are restored before this method returns.

        Parameters:
        executable - The file to read the program from.
        buffer - The ByteBuffer to store the program bytes in.
        offset - The starting index.
        Returns:
        An EjvmProgram instance representing the eJVM program read from executable.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If executable does not exist.
        BufferOverflowException - If the capacity or limit of buffer are insufficient to store the program.
        RuntimeException - In case of any IO error.
